channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rural towns are handing out $10,000 relocation bonuses to poach high-earning remote workers
item.description: Forget corporate tax breaks. Cities now pay remote workers to move in.

item.title: Newsmax Accuses Fox News of Violating Antitrust Laws
item.description: The smaller outlet in conservative TV news argued in a lawsuit that Fox News had essentially created a monopoly. Fox said the case had no merit.

item.title: The Met Opera Turns to Saudi Arabia to Help Solve Its Financial Woes
item.description: The Met, which has withdrawn $120 million from its endowment since the pandemic, reached a lucrative deal to perform in Saudi Arabia for three weeks e...

item.title: Trump says the video of garbage bags dropped out of a White House window was AI-generated, ironically adding, people ‘blame AI’ to cover up bad things
item.description: Despite the president’s denial, the video remains authentic, according to multiple officials.

item.title: Senator’s Visit to Spy Agency Was Canceled After Laura Loomer Complained
item.description: Senator Mark Warner’s visit was classified and not intended to be publicized. It was to include a meeting with the head of the agency and a briefing o...

item.title: Trump Advisers Have Discussed a Job for Adams if He Quits Mayor’s Race
item.description: The conversations have also involved finding a place for Curtis Sliwa with the goal of giving Andrew Cuomo a better chance of defeating Zohran Mamdani...

item.title: Super Bowl ad spots that cost millions a piece already sold out even though the event is still more than 150 days away
item.description: NBCUniversal, which has the rights to next February’s Super Bowl, has entirely sold out ad inventory during the big game.

item.title: Harvard Secures a Court Victory in Its Fight With Trump
item.description: Harvard had sued the Trump administration in an effort to restore billions in research funds that the government canceled this spring.

item.title: McDonald’s CEO is grappling with a ‘two-tier economy’ as he slashes prices on value meals—and signals backing for a minimum wage increase
item.description: “Particularly with middle- and lower-income consumers, they’re feeling under a lot of pressure right now,” Chris Kempczinski said on CNBC.

item.title: One out of every 4 homes is at ‘severe or extreme’ climate risk, study says
item.description: Some $12.7 trillion of Americans' housing wealth is exposed to the climate change crisis.

item.title: U.S. and Mexico Vow to Cooperate Against Crime as Rubio Meets Sheinbaum
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with President Claudia Sheinbaum, after she pressed the Trump administration not to take unilateral action in Mexic...

item.title: At Least 15 Dead After Lisbon Funicular Derails and Crashes, Officials Say
item.description: The funicular line, one of three in Lisbon, is a popular tourist attraction.

item.title: Trump Welcomes Poland’s Right-Wing President to White House
item.description: The meeting between President Trump and Poland’s largely ceremonial president, Karol Nawrocki, highlighted divisions within the biggest economic and m...

item.title: Funicular Accident Leaves Several Dead in Lisbon
item.description: According to Portugal’s health ministry, at least 15 people were killed and 18 others were injured after the Elevador da Glória derailed and crashed i...

item.title: China’s Show of Military Might
item.description: Xi Jinping’s huge military parade in Tiananmen Square provided a rare look at China’s new weapons.
